channel.title: Player Rights
channel.description:
Thank you for veiwing this. Please help me. I want to make it so that when I give player rights 4 to a player (for donator) they can not do the mod admin and owner commands (1,2,and 3 rights). How can I do this?
Example: player rights 1 Player Moderator username has logged in.
player rights 2 Administrator username has logged in.
player rights 3 Owner and Coder username has logged in.
player rights 4 [$]Donator username has logged in.
I just dont want the donators being able to do staff commands. PLEASE HELP! OTHER INFO:::::::::::::: Source: Allstar 317

item.title: Player Rights
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:518980”]Think: if you use the >= operator to say greater than or equal to, then what could you do to make it less than or equal to?
[size=4pt]Hint: c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3[/size][/quote]

Thank you. It worked. (:

Read full topic

item.title: Player Rights
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Think: if you use the >= operator to say greater than or equal to, then what could you do to make it less than or equal to?
[size=4pt]Hint: c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3[/size]

item.title: Player Rights
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

Thank you for veiwing this. Please help me.
I want to make it so that when I give player rights 4 to a player (for donator) they can not do the mod admin and owner commands (1,2,and 3 rights).
How can I do this?

Example:
player rights 1
Player Moderator username has logged in.

player rights 2
Administrator username has logged in.

player rights 3
Owner and Coder username has logged in.

player rights 4
[$]Donator username has logged in.

I just dont want the donators being able to do staff commands.
PLEASE HELP!
OTHER INFO::::::::::::::
Source: Allstar 317

Read full topic
